error.signature: ERROR: Could not install packages due to an OSError: [Errno 28] No space left on device

verdict.summary: The filesystem is full during pip install. Pip needs space for downloading, caching, and extracting packages. Often occurs in Docker containers with small /tmp or in CI environments with limited disk.

dead_ends.why_fails: While it helps marginally, the extracted package and build artifacts still need disk space; if the disk is truly full, this is insufficient

dead_ends.action: Delete random files to free space without checking what uses disk
dead_ends.why_fails: May delete critical system files or virtualenv; the pip cache or /tmp build files are usually the culprits

workarounds.action: Clear pip cache and tmp, then retry: pip cache purge && rm -rf /tmp/pip-*
workarounds.how: pip cache purge && rm -rf /tmp/pip-* /tmp/pip-build-* && pip install <package>

workarounds.action: Redirect pip temp directory to a larger partition using TMPDIR
workarounds.condition: when /tmp is on a small partition

workarounds.action: In Docker, increase build layer size or use multi-stage builds
workarounds.how: Use multi-stage Docker build: install in builder stage with more space, copy only site-packages to final image

leads_to.condition: when disk fills during cache write leaving partial files

preceded_by.condition: when build isolation creates too many temp environments

frequently_confused_with.distinction: No-space-left is about insufficient disk space; cache-corruption is about corrupted cached files which can happen after a space issue but has different symptoms
